info.title: Payment Provider Protocol
info.description:
The Payment Provider Protocol is a set of definitions to help you integrate your payment processing API into VTEX platform, including sub-acquirers, acquirers, gateways and custom payment services. To achieve this, you need to implement a web API (REST) following the specifications from this documentation. ##### MORE INFORMATION --- > *VTEX Help Center - Payment Provider Protocol* > > *https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/payment-provider-protocol* ##### ENDPOINT REQUIREMENTS --- > › Must use a standard subdomain/domain name, and not a IP address.
> › Must be served over HTTPS on port 443 with TLS 1.2 support.
> › Must respond in less than 5 seconds when running the tests.
> › Must respond in less than 20 seconds when in production.
> › Must be PCI-DSS compliant to accept branded cards like Visa, Mastercard, Amex, etc. ##### TESTING --- > *VTEX - Payment Provider Test Suite* > > *https://apps.vtex.com/vtex-payment-provider-test-suite/p* > > *An extra header* `X-VTEX-API-Is-TestSuite` = `true` *will be sent for every test suite request, to help you easily identify it and mock any required scenarios.* ##### COMMON PARAMETERS IN THE DOCUMENTATION ---
{{providerApiEndpoint}} Provider's endpoint for the implementation
{{X-VTEX-API-AppKey}} The AppKey configured by the merchant
{{X-VTEX-API-AppToken}} The AppToken configured by the merchant

get.description: Return all payment methods that your provider can handle. Please make sure you are returning only supported payment methods as listed below.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Media type of the body of the request. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

get.description: Exposes provider manifest, a range of metadata settings, like payment methods, split configuration and custom fields.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Media type of the body of the request. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

post.description: Creates a new payment and/or initiates the payment flow.

parameters.name: X-VTEX-API-AppKey
parameters.description: The AppKey configured by the merchant (optional configuration)

parameters.name: X-VTEX-API-AppToken
parameters.description: The AppToken configured by the merchant (optional configuration)

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Media type(s) that is/are acceptable for the response. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The Media type of the body of the request. Default value for payment provider protocol is application/json

reference.title: reference
reference.description: Merchant's order reference provided by VTEX Checkout.

orderId.title: orderId
orderId.description: Merchant's order identifier provided by VTEX Checkout (also called order group).

shopperInteraction.title: shopperInteraction
shopperInteraction.description: Indicates which system the buyer interacted with (examples: e-commerce, instore, subscription).

verificationOnly.title: verificationOnly
verificationOnly.description: Indicates whether this payment is just to validate the buyer's payment method information (for instance, validate the credit card information).

transactionId.title: transactionId
transactionId.description: VTEX transaction ID related to this payment.

paymentId.title: paymentId
paymentId.description: VTEX payment ID that can be used as unique identifier.

paymentMethod.title: paymentMethod
paymentMethod.description: The payment method chosen for this payment. It must be one of the available payment methods offered by the provider, which can be obtained from the [List Payment Methods endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/paymentmethods) or [List Payment Provider Manifest endpoint](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/manifest-1).

paymentMethodCustomCode.title: paymentMethodCustomcode
paymentMethodCustomCode.description: Configurable for Cobranded and Privatelabels payment methods.

merchantName.title: merchantName
merchantName.description: VTEX merchant name that will receive the payment.

deviceFingerprint.title: deviceFingerprint
deviceFingerprint.description: A hash that represents the device used to initiate the payment.

ipAddress.title: ipAddress
ipAddress.description: The IP Address of the buyer.

card.title: Card
card.description: Card used in the payment. This parameter is required only with card payment methods (credit, debit or co-branded).

bin.title: bin
bin.description: First 6 digits of the card number (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

numberToken.title: numberToken
numberToken.description: A token representing the card number (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

numberLength.title: numberLength
numberLength.description: The number of characters in the card number (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

cscToken.title: cscToken
cscToken.description: A token representing the card security code (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

cscLength.title: cscLength
cscLength.description: The number of characters in the Card Security Code (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

isCorporate.title: isCorporate
isCorporate.description: Indicates whether or not the buyer is corporate. If `true`, the fields `corporateName`, `tradeName` and `corporateDocument` are required.

corporateName.title: corporateName
corporateName.description: Buyer's corporate name. This field is required if `isCorporate` is `true`.

tradeName.title: tradeName
tradeName.description: Buyer's trade name. This field is required if `isCorporate` is `true`.

corporateDocument.title: corporateDocument
corporateDocument.description: Buyer's corporate document number. This field is required if `isCorporate` is `true`.

createdDate.title: createdDate
createdDate.description: Buyer's create datetime in format yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.

shippingAddress.title: shippingAddress
shippingAddress.description: Shipping address. Address where the purchase will be delivered.

billingAddress.title: billingAddress
billingAddress.description: Billing address. Address of the payer.

items.title: items
items.description: Items of the cart of the purchase.

deliveryType.title: deliveryType
deliveryType.description: The delivery SLA selected for this item. Possible values in Brazil, for instance, are PAC, SEDEX.

sellerId.title: sellerId
sellerId.description: In case of a marketplace transaction, this is the Id of the seller for this specific item. Otherwise, this is filled with a '1'.

taxRate.description: Value of the sum of all Taxes applied to each item. Rates are in percentage, so 5% is represented as 0.05.

taxValue.description: Total Tax value of the item (taxRate times value).

role.description: Indicates if the recipient is the seller or the marketplace.
role.title: role

chargeProcessingFee.title: chargeProcessingFee
chargeProcessingFee.description: Indicates whether or not this recipient is charged for processing fees.

chargebackLiable.title: chargebackLiable
chargebackLiable.description: Indicates whether or not this recipient is liable to chargebacks.

merchantSettings.title: merchantSettings
merchantSettings.description: Custom fields (for the given Provider) which the Merchant must fill. Each element of this array is a key-value pair.

url.title: url
url.description: The order URL from merchant's backoffice.

inboundRequestUrl.title: inboundRequestUrl
inboundRequestUrl.description: The URL to call for the Inbound Request (BETA).

secureProxyUrl.title: secureProxyUrl
secureProxyUrl.description: The URL for the Secure Proxy to authorize the Payment (this field is absent in case the provider does not use the Secure Proxy).

sandBoxMode.title: sandBoxMode
sandBoxMode.description: Indicates whether or not this request is being sent from a sandbox environment.

totalCartValue.description: Total amount of the shopping cart that this payment is part of. It can be used together with the value to calculate the percentage that this payment represents of the total.

callbackUrl.title: callbackUrl
callbackUrl.description: The URL you need to call to send the callbacks (notification or retry) of payment status changes.

returnUrl.title: returnUrl
returnUrl.description: The URL you need to redirect the end user back to merchant's store when using the redirect flow.

parameters.name: token

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: VTEX application identifier

parameters.name: authorizationCode

paymentMethods.description: Describes each payment method supported by payment provider and exposed its respective metadata.

allowsSplit.description: Describes which transaction flow stage the connector should receive payment split data. Accepted values: `onAuthorize`, `onCapture`, `disabled`. Check more details on the [Split Payouts on the Payment Provider Protocol](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/split-payouts-on-payment-provider-protocol) article.

items.description: Describes the customized fields supported by the connector.

options.description: In case of `select` type, the possible params are `text` and `value`.

autoSettleDelay.description: Describes the allowed delay value for the auto settle capture. Accepted values: `minimum` and `maximum` in whole hours (decimals are not allowed). Check more details on the [Custom Auto Capture Feature](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/custom-auto-capture-feature) article.

minimum.description: Minimum amount of time to auto settle in hours.

maximum.description: Maximum amount of time to auto settle in hours.

example.message: The currency ABC is not supported

authorizationId.description: Payment authorization identifier (in case it was authorized previous to the cancellation request).

sandboxMode.description: Indicates whether or not this request is being sent from a sandbox environment.

merchantSettings.title: merchantSettings
merchantSettings.description: Custom fields (for the given Provider) which the Merchant must fill. Each element of this array is a key-value pair.

example.message: Cancellation has failed due to an internal error
Settlement has failed due to an internal error
Refund has failed due to an internal error

transactionId.description: VTEX identifier for the transaction related to this payment.

requestId.description: The unique identifier for this request to ensure its idempotency.

authorizationId.description: The authorization identifier for this payment.

tid.description: Provider's unique identifier for the transaction.

recipients.description: Array containing the information for the recipients of this payment in case the Payment Provider is configured to allow the split of payments.

role.description: Indicates if the recipient is the seller or the marketplace.

chargeProcessingFee.description: Indicates whether or not this recipient is charged for processing fees.

chargebackLiable.description: Indicates whether or not this recipient is liable to chargebacks.

commissionAmount.description: Amount of commission due to the marketplace.

sandboxMode.description: Indicates whether or not this request is being sent from a sandbox environment.

tags.name: Payment Flow
tags.description: Here we describe each operation you need to implement for the payment flow.

tags.name: Configuration Flow
tags.description:
Here we describe each operation you need to implement to enable the optional configuration flow.

This is an easier way to allow VTEX merchants to enable your connector, and be ready to use it without having to copy/paste any credentials (`AppKey`/`AppToken`).
